review: I really could not use this as I had expected.  A customer service person had told me that this would communicate with the Kindle Fire HD 6, but it did not, so I ended up having to return it.  Other than that it may be useful to someone that likes a device that is almost solely based on pay per view capability.  Almost every choice on the menu that it presents is commercial and not based on communicating with the web/internet directly.  Some of you may be interested in an item like this if you have a device such as a tablet that will communicate with the web/tv combination, but other than that it seems sort of commercial and in some ways based on membership to services.
